website_summaries.verdict: A light-duty, stair-climbing hand truck in a wide variety of colors.  Use it for grocery shopping, outings, and more.
pros: Cart can be pushed or pulled
Use it for small loads to save your back
Without the included bag, it can be used as a dolly with a capacity of 110 pounds
cons: This is not a heavy-duty hand truck and therefore won't be suitable for everyone

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are sturdy. The Velcro on the smaller cart for $50
customer_reviews.text: Velcro that holds bag in place is flimsy, hence the bag the falls off the cart, or falls out the back and drags on the ground-dirty and torn. Am holding it up with safety pins. Wheels are sturdy. The Velcro on the smaller cart for $50. is sturdy, but the wheels flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Passion

customer_reviews.title: Junk, do not buy. Used twice and bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk, do not buy. Used twice and bag has 2 holes on the bottom. Does not stay on platform and is very heavy. Bag is made of very cheap material and does not hold groceries. Senior citizens should not buy this product because it is very heavy to pull and you can see from image, used only one time with milk containers in bottle, the quality of the bag is not durable and tears. There is no refund after 30 days which is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Stanton

customer_reviews.title: It will go up stairs as advertised, but just ...
customer_reviews.text: It will go up stairs as advertised, but just be advised that if your stairs do not have the rise (stairs have a "rise" and a "run" ... run = the part you step on, rise= the vertical part) then it won't climb the stairs as it should. I gave this item 4 stars because the wheels are hard to move, which is less of a problem if you have it loaded but more of a problem if it's empty and pulling it along a more slick floor.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy, goes up all kinds of sizes of stairs
customer_reviews.text: very sturdy, goes up all kinds of sizes of stairs, no problem with it at all. I loaded up more than a 100 lbs of cat litter boxes, tied them down with bungee cords and it didn't bend anythings, worked perfect to take up 2 floors.
customer_reviews.author: A Catlover In Colorado

customer_reviews.title: I wish the wheels were rubber not plastic but they work fine so far I just don't know if they will ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother-in-law who lives in our upstairs apartment. She loves it for bringing up her groceries. I wish the wheels were rubber not plastic but they work fine so far I just don't know if they will last on the gravel driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Griswold

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING IS AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS AWESOME!!!!! I bought this for my daughter who lives on the second floor of an apartment building. This allows her to load her groceries and haul them upstairs with ease!! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnna

customer_reviews.title: Way too short in height
customer_reviews.text: This product needs to be much taller at the handle. When going downstairs, you are bent almost all the way over and that makes it even harder to balance yourself than if you were carrying the items in one hand and holding on to the handrail with the other. A telescoping handle that could raise up another 18 inches would greatly improve this little product. Ours is now taking space in the basement utility room and not being used.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Unique design allows for hassle free climbing up stairsways
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the design and functionality of this dolly. My 3yr old daughter effortlessly pulled it up the stairs. It's very practical for so many other everyday uses aside from groceries and laundry. I don't often leave feedback, but I felt this product deserved it.
customer_reviews.author: caliagent

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter last Christmas, which was a waste. It was a good idea and worked for a while but as you can see from the picture, it doesn't last. Now, I'm looking for another one, hopefully a better one, this Christmas. Yikes, and she liked it, but don't waste your money on this one!
customer_reviews.author: srwms2792

customer_reviews.title: Unless you're going to have something very narrow or put it in the bag save you money
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be great for taking luggage in large boxes up stairwells but the wheels are too high so they hit anything wider than the wheelbase
customer_reviews.author: mary U

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The plastic plate on which the bag rests arrived broken - it had snapped off at the point where it attaches to the vertical tubing. In general the load-bearing structure looks very flimsy; the plastic parts are very thin and don't look like they will hold up for long under use. The stair-climbing wheel assembly is large overall and doesn't fold up so that the overall size of the carrier is quite large even when folded.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: The best rolling bag I have tried
customer_reviews.text: This bag has been a travel nurse life saver—it saves my from hauling two large bags everywhere I go, and thus saves my back, neck, and shoulders. Everything I need and would put in the locker that we don’t have as travelers fits, with side pockets for my water bottles and more. Supplies, food, water, purse, they all fit. It really does climb any curb or stairs I have attempted, and rolls quietly. It is easy to pick up the front brace and lift into the trunk. I have tried more than one rolling bag and this is the only one I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Asher

customer_reviews.title: The best thing for carting groceries into your house.
customer_reviews.text: This is one product that delivers as advertised. It climbs right up stairs, or over obstacles such as found with sliding glass doors, and makes taking groceries into the house from your car as easy as one-two-three. Where I used to make as many as 7 or 8 trips from the car to my house to put away groceries each week, I now make only two trips. And the Trolley Dolly makes each trip so much easier than carrying heavy grocery bags. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: G. David Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on stairs.
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I expected and needed. Very good going up and down my 3 flights of stairs. It can be a little noisy on the stairs but if I go slow it's fine. The one dislike is the smell. Not sure if it's the plastic that lines the bag but I have tried everything. After 2 weeks it's better but still there. It smells like chemicals. Other than that I'm please with the overall performance and look.
customer_reviews.author: lisa brown

customer_reviews.title: While this shows on tv and online as a sturdy dolly, the base is too narrow and makes ...
customer_reviews.text: While this shows on tv and online as a sturdy dolly , the base is too narrow and makes it difficult to bring a 24 pack of water easily up a flight of stairs. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Confirmed customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for big, bulky items
customer_reviews.text: Pictured are the bags of cat litter that i normally get from Costco. They are 42lbs each. The review stated that the dolly can hold up to 110lbs and still make it up the stairs with the triple wheels. I was able to get these bags of cat litter plus another 40lb bag of cat litter on a separate trip into my apartment with ease. I would definitely recommend some sort of bungee cords if the heavy item is bulky. The bag that it comes with is very roomy and you're able to fit a lot of things like laundry and groceries, but i haven't tried that as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: purplgrrl41

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for work and so far I am very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: I just received this on Sunday, 04/22/18. I bought it for work and so far I am very satisfied with it. I have back and neck problems and use it to carry a backpack containing paperwork and a laptop and other misc items. It is very light weight and easy to pull and navigate. And it really does go up stairs without a struggle! The only other thing that I can think of that it would be nice to have is an adjustable handle to be able to raise the height. I’m 5’3” and I could use an extra 2 or 3 inches in height.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Needs design improvement
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product ✌️ 🌟 because I had to return the first one because the right wheel fell off for no apparent reason. I received a replacement. Now I find that the tray to lay boxes on is not wide enough to accommodate wide boxes. Poor design because they could have either made the tray wider or at least made it foldable so if the customer needed more space to accommodate larger items he can either slide out the extension or fold it out.
customer_reviews.author: Raul E. Zayas

customer_reviews.title: ... that I can pull up and down from stairs easily. If you intend to carry 5-8 lb it ...
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I bought this was so that I can pull up and down from stairs easily. If you intend to carry 5-8 lb it could be okay. Mine one broke the first time I use it carry grocery up and down from subway station. Not sturdy enough ! I could have used taxi instead. :(
customer_reviews.author: KALSANG

customer_reviews.title: ?Quality Control?
customer_reviews.text: My one problem with this is that the Velcro fasteners do not line up and are even misaligned with one going vertical and the matching one is horizontally oriented!! Seems like ther is no quality control happening here.
customer_reviews.author: Proudmary

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother and she loves it! She carried firewood in, travels and shops with it. Closed steps was easy she said but a little problem with open steps. She bought her friend one that lives 3 stories up. When they opened it the piece that locks the wheels was missing. I have never experienced the great customer this company has, they overnighted another one with no hassles. I will purchase more from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I really love this stair climber. It's lightweight and goes up and down stairs easily. The material is of high quality, and there are a lot of convenient pockets to store items in. And I like the fact that the items inside it can't be viewed as I push it down the sidewalk. As a senior with orthopedic problems living on the second floor, I find this item to not only be convenient, but a necessity for me!
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Stair Climber Trolley Dolly 2
customer_reviews.text: I used this trolley for my school supplies wheeling it back and forth to my car and school. It was very useful. All the wheels turned appropriately, the handle was easy to grip and soft. I would say just to pack light items into the trolley. I accidentally filled it up and the seam loosened. But it is a good purchase. I also used it to carry my groceries.
customer_reviews.author: Brigida Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my parents and they can’t be without it. Mid-80s and without it they could not bring in their groceries or other purchases. It can help people be independent and ....it’s made well! Wheels climb curbs and can be pulled up apartment steps. I wish I could buy 50 and keep in my trunk for every senior I see carrying grocery bags. This cart is so essential.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Needs an adjustable handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle needs to be adjustable! I'm 5'10 and have to slouch a little to use this, 1-2 inches of adjustability and it would be perfect. That said, I'm a left arm amputee and this is a life saver for taking groceries up 3 flights of stairs. its very smooth going up stairs and holds a lot, I can fit most grocery runs in one trip.
customer_reviews.author: bebomber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Lightweight Loads; Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for moving lightweight loads. Small enough that you don't feel like you are lugging airport luggage. I use mine for moving a few file folders, a laptop, and my purse from my car to my classroom. I'm 5'2 and it's not too big for me to pull. I like that I can fold it up quickly and toss it on the back seat of my car after I empty it. It's made with a lot of plastic and I realize it isn't going to last for 30 years like my all-metal wheeled-suitcases but it is perfect for me for now. And the color is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: rosie

customer_reviews.title: Useful product for traversing stairs!
customer_reviews.text: A lightweight product that works as advertised. I'd like to see one made with battery drive motor for wheels, larger & more substantial for larger & heavier usage. Until then I'll use this greatfully for the job it does. A godsend for traversing stairs. I recommend this product, especially for seniors who may need help with carrying groceries up stairs.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Since suffering from a really bad knee replacement surgery I have to use a cane or walker just to get around, so getting my groceries from the vehicle to the house and up some stairs was very discouraging and exhausting. I had another brand, with skinny tires, which got the job done but kept losing a wheel now and then. Since I have had this trolley I have had no trouble what so ever, I'm loving it!!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Y.

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! I have 2 flights of stairs and am getting really tired of dragging and carrying 5 gallon bottles of water up the stairs. This little stair climber makes it so much easier for me. I haven’t tried the bag yet but next grocery shopping day I will try it again with the bag and see how that works. So far, I am happy and I believe it’s well worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Luz M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Returning this item. Mom has COPD and Fibromyalgia, so she really needs something like this. Lightweight is nice, yet this product is simply not built to last. Flimsy red bag holds less than two standard grocery bags. Needs an extra tie not included to secure bag from falling off dolly. Plastic wheels means little traction. I personally could not use it to carry one small 500BTU A/C up one flight of stairs, ended up just grabbing then huffed it up there myself. This purchase truly left me feeling like I had been taken advantage of.
customer_reviews.author: Immortal Fish

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase of my life
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I use this thing I say the same thing, WORST PURCHASE OF MY LIFE, and I'm old so that is saying a lot!! I have used it a couple of times with the "sack" attached and it's ok but I use it more for just transporting things that are too heavy to carry. The platform on it is just too inadequate for almost anything. It's just junk.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: good for stairs
customer_reviews.text: I like the three wheels for stairs. I only have two steps to get into the house from the garage but very nice that this goes up them with a little effort. I unfortunately seem to buy more groceries than will fit in the bag so have to make two trips but it is much better than draping the bags over my arms. Makes bringing in the groceries much easier. Even used it to transport PC equipment.
customer_reviews.author: who knew

customer_reviews.title: Most import to me is how easy it is for me to handle all by my self. My husband went to help me and I told him NO that I have to
customer_reviews.text: WOW !!!! Exactly what I need to bring my 5 gallon water bottles up 3 outside steps and into my kitchen. Perfect for an older couple. Love, love, Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andronike Sweeting

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a life saver!
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a house with stairs. At 73 years of age, 2 back surgeries and an ongoing rib condition, I could no longer lift things without suffering. Now I pack my laundry to go downstairs and my groceries to come upstairs. Thinking of ordering another one to permanently keep in car for when I go shopping. Can't say enough good things about this little dandy. fabric is strong, plastic liner, pockets, some with zippers. Nice rubber handle. Easy to assemble, really.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight. Very easy to manipulate. Better than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: AnnB

customer_reviews.title: She just texted me that it worked great for getting the groceries upstairs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter for Christmas. She just texted me that it worked great for getting the groceries upstairs, but the bag was not very durable as the seam on the side ripped and the top strap that goes around the cart handle tore out with only 15 lbs. of groceries in it. Paid a lot for something that lasted barely a day. Received a new bag and now the Trolley Dolly works as it should!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie P

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Does not climb all stairs. Bought for my daughter who lives on the second floor. Thought it would make it easier for her than carrying bagsup. Nope! The stair treads were small. Cart not suitable. But she thought it would be great for all her college books. She said slot of people are using this cart instead of back packs. Saved!
customer_reviews.author: Lind Lindstrand

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart
customer_reviews.text: Great little cart just need a longer handle Bec the cart tracks too close to my legs im only 5'5" I climb 15 step stairs every day with up to 50 lbs I dont use the bag but hv 2 large insulated sq boxes bungied to cart Also i had to put a 4" block to keep load out of wheels
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE D.

customer_reviews.title: Impractical for my use
customer_reviews.text: This would be great for groceries or small loads only. It does not work at all if the stairs are spaced too far apart. It is also unstable and tips easily when trying to put more than one box or item on it. It works great if you can fit items in the bag, does not work well without the bag. To use for boxes, I had to tape a platform on it so the box would not hit the wheels and stop them from turning.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Casura

customer_reviews.title: Three wheels make it so easy!
customer_reviews.text: I can fill the storage bag right from the trunk of my car and pull gently the cart to my single step into my home’s mud room. A very gentle but firm pull and it climbs that step no matter what weight it carries. Six plastic shopping bags fit comfortably in it. Best purchase yet. I had wanted a cart, but this climbs stairs, no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Sue from Oro Valley

customer_reviews.title: It has made the job of bringing packages up and down my 2nd story walk-up infinitely better. I've used it to carry two large loa
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my new Trolley Dolly. It has made the job of bringing packages up and down my 2nd story walk-up infinitely better. I've used it to carry two large loads of laundry to the laundromat and have also used it to bring home groceries, including heavy bottles of water. It has done a great job. Thank you for an amazing little cart!
customer_reviews.author: Komplehx

customer_reviews.title: Back-saver!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tool. Crazy amazing how it goes up stairs. Daughter lives in 3rd floor apt and it is perfect for hauling up groceries and cases of water. Works fine on exterior, open concrete stairs. Limitation is size of platform-won’t work for oversized boxes, etc.—however for everyday trips upstairs, it is great. Easy to assemble. Would be 5-star if wheels folded in for ease of storage in back of car, however that is minor compared to the benefits of not hand-carrying groceries and supplies up 3 flights!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for 40# softener salt bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to help me transfer 40# softener salt bags down to the basement. I did so for 4 bags, one at a time, making it a 160# total. The bags didn’t fall off through the back even though I didn’t install the canvas bag that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ghanem J.

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy cart.
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy cart that goes up and down stairs easily. It has lots of pockets. I use it for carting art supplies to class. I wish the handle extended and that the base was over the wheels. I put a block of styrofoam on the base, when I need to transport paintings, then strap them on. Otherwise the wheels interfere if art extends over the wheels. I like that the cart stands on its own and does not tip, if weight shifts to one side.i
customer_reviews.author: Grancy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The platform on the dolly should be above the wheels. You can only load items that are the same width as the platform, anything wider will rub up against the wheels defeating the purpose. Its great for a shopping cart but as far as a dolly that's a negative. Unfortunately I saw what I was looking for after this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Streetz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Life changing, I love this thing, everyone is so jealous when they see it like oh how smart. I use it at Target, Walmart, CVS, wherever I need it. Makes my life living on the third floor of a dorm with no car so much easier. For assembly, when they say press the lock they mean press it down not in. It’ll save you 10 minutes of messing around getting frustrated and almost breaking it like I did XD
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and very useful for long stairways.
customer_reviews.text: A superb device for getting my groceries and other heavy items down a long flight of stairs at our condo. Also is very useful in getting the trash up the stairs to the garage where my waste bins are located. The wheels turn freely, so you do have to keep a good grip on the cart, or it can get away from you. But it sure helps my back in carrying heavy and clumsy objects up and down the stairway.
customer_reviews.author: George F. Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Carries a lot wt wise and very easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Carries a lot wt wise and very easy to go up & down stairs! My son loves it--easy to get to the 2nd floor now!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I read a couple of mediocre reviews and decided to buy it anyway. It does exactly what I wanted and needed it to do. I love that is lightweight. Someone said it would haul about 10 pounds. I tried moving 50 pounds. It did a good job. I don't do that every day but I'm super pleased with this product. And it's pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Climbs stairs no problem if you live in an apartment ...
customer_reviews.text: Climbs stairs no problem if you live in an apartment and dont want to carry stuff up a bunch of stairs this baby is the problem solver
customer_reviews.author: Vashon Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for someone wanting to carry several bags of LIGHT groceries up the stairs. It’s pretty useless as a normal dolly because the platform is too small. I’ve had many things fall off it. I’ve had to rig some bungee straps to keep things from falling off. I’d say this thing only will carry 50-60 pounds comfortably. The handle also doesn’t go up high enough. I’m 5’5 and have to lean over to pull this up the stairs. This product definitely isn’t a life changing product. I’d think a normal dolly with big wheels would be just as efficient and can be used for more than lightweight groceries.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Handle is too short.
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are great for stairs, but the handle isn't long enough to pull the trolley dolly up the stairs without having to bend over at an awkward and with my bad back, painful, angle - And I'm only 5'2". I bought it for hauling groceries up to my 2nd floor apartment, so the awkward painful bending over is too long in duration to endure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good cart!
customer_reviews.text: This is very light weight and I do not know how to pack things on the cart so it will not fall off. There are no straps to hold the items so they will not fall off. I saw this cart $29 cheaper. That's really is what it's worth. Just good for rolling up on stairs only.
customer_reviews.author: raeellis

customer_reviews.title: Size does matter.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed when I tried to put items into the bag. The entrance to the bag seems small, you have to pay attention closer to make sure things will fit. Plus the base platform is between the wheels, instead of above, so your limited to width you are carrying. Like that it compact and the climbing wheel feature really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Lea King

customer_reviews.title: Just as pretty and useful as it looks
customer_reviews.text: Very nice love the teal color Moves up stairs nicely It is a little smaller than my other brand that I have but so far I like it and will probably get another Easy to clean just spray with mild disinfectant especially these days
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: IF YOU WANT IT TO OTHER COUNTRY DO NOT BUY IT THEY PUT MORE AIR IN THE PACKGE THAT ACTUAL PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I PAY 300$ in delivery from the USA to Honduras, I believe that amazon package personnel or policies do not give a dam of the environment, for the sake of God, use the right package.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Good product..Long trip!
customer_reviews.text: The dolly works great. Wish the bag we got had been a little wider and held more, but just took a couple more trips. Works great going up our stairs into the house. The only problem that we had was the package went to 3 or 4 different states in the wrong direction and was several days late. We were kept informed constantly about the US tour our bag experienced on it's way to us. Each time it went another way we started laughing... as it just struck us funny. We expected to see little stickers from states across the country.
customer_reviews.author: Beckzilla51

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to haul water up 3 flights of stairs. It works well at climbing stairs. However, I am 5'10 and the handle is little short causing me to have to stoop as I pull it up the stairs, but it does beat trying to grip the 40 pack of water by the shotty plastic wrapping and carry up 3 flights.
customer_reviews.author: VQB

customer_reviews.title: Wheels and connections cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: The wheels do the job when they stay on. The bag that holds groceries is smaller than it looks, its good for a few bags but not big orders. In my opinion it’s probably best if you have a case or two of water to go upstairs and as someone who delivers groceries for instacart and amazon that part is good. If your a flexer or ic shopper I’d suggest finding one with bigger capacity
customer_reviews.author: Bob3007

customer_reviews.title: Almost there but not yet ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery is prompted, but the item designed with a small surface to carry a small bag or will cornered to the wheels. And the ads didn't shown well the size of the bottom platform.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted it to work
customer_reviews.text: Product works if, and I repeat IF the load is no wider than the frame. If you have a box wider, it will hit the wheels and fall off. Be aware of this!
customer_reviews.author: H. Yap

customer_reviews.title: Stair Climber Wheels - Pretty Cool - Still Breaking In But Seems To Be Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Just like the picture. Very Little Assembly Needed. Instructions are fairly straightforward. Just have to be careful when packing the bag with Groceries to haul upstairs. About 100Lbs of stuff made it up 6 flights of stairs with very little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not your grandmother's shlepy metal shopping cart !!
customer_reviews.text: The cart was easy to assemble and I have used it a few times already. It holds about 2 paper bags worth of groceries. It has some zippered pockets which are great to put money, keys, shopping list, etc. Also, I have 3 flights of stairs to go up and down to my market and the wheels make it very easy to maneuver . Also, it is waterproof and lightweight. I would definitely recommend this product and the black paisley print is very hip looking !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stairs with a lip are a bit of a problem for this dolly
customer_reviews.text: I wish our stairs were flush with no overhanging lip. This cart would be very easy to use then. As it is it is still useful but it takes quite a tug to get it over the lip. The bag is a little small for my re-usable bags so I'm going to use bungee cords to hold them instead of the bag. Easy to assemble, nice looking and rolls easily
customer_reviews.author: Linda R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: The cart has wheels that are too small. The hub of the wheels hits the nose of the stair tread as the cart is raised and lowered. This can mar the tread. I wanted this cart to raise and lower large, heavy luggage bags but the cart's platform sits between the narrowly spaced wheels and the suit case rubs heavily on the wheels, making rolling needlessly difficult and wearing on the suit case. Nice nylon bag good for groceries but other carts are better because of the poor stair climbing capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good on stairs, not on the flat.
customer_reviews.text: If you only want this trolley to go up and down stairs then it is five star. However, when I tried to wheel it along a flat surface the wheels did not rotate properly and, in effect, I was dragging it along. This seems to be because the wheels appear to have no bearings.
customer_reviews.author: careful

customer_reviews.title: I Now Know I'll Need This Product IN the Future
customer_reviews.text: I like the versatility of this product as well as it's constant-in-demand availability...it did not come in time for one task; but now I realize it will be a great hack in the future! Thank you, dbest!!
customer_reviews.author: Anina Berthold

customer_reviews.title: Ehh , I mean I guess you can buy it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother , he lives on the second floor , this is able to roll up stairs but the wheels get in the way of placing something larger than the bottom plate form, so if you want to bring boxes or a cooler larger - wider than the bottom platform - won’t work because the wheels block it It’s pretty small btw I am 5 feet and it was up to my mid leg , it seems wabally and not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: I just got this and love it. Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and love it. Easy to put together. I have not used it yet but am sure t will be great. Looks like it will hold alot. I highly suggest this item. Can't wait to use it. The only thing is that it has a slight odor, but i am sure it will go away after a little while being out of the packaging and opened up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The turning radius is limited. Wide turns are best
customer_reviews.text: Love love this thing! Of course I live on the second story of a condo and those stairs are horrible, so this is amazing. I can carry everything. Even my 5 gallon water jug with it, no strap required. Def a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Ozuna

customer_reviews.title: Happy!  Buy one for your health :)
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing. It shipped fast, assembly took 2 minutes, and cats love it. It is nice to have the cup holder to hold stuff. Took the more curious kitty first and the second kitty the next day. Tied night feeding to after the walk and now, day 4, they both stand by the stroller reminding us it's time to go.
customer_reviews.author: Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter who live in third floor apartment. She uses it all the time and loves it. Sturdy, holds a lots of grocery bags.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The chemical smell will knock you over when you open the bag that goes with the cart. While easy to assemble when I went to lock the wheels in place one of the wheel locks broke off. Shelf to support water jugs is very small also. Unfortunately I brought with me out of the country or I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent Girl

customer_reviews.title: I saw this on the TV show Shark Tank and ...
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on the TV show Shark Tank and got it for my college age daughter as she lives on the 3rd floor of her dorm. She loves it and others in the dorm have asked about it too.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Ragman

customer_reviews.title: The canvas was ripped open down one side so product was unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even want to give this one star, I purchased this as a christmas gift so I didn't open the packaging big mistake the canvas tote part was complete torn all way down the side so unusable. I had planned on purchasing another one for myself but that want happen. Very poor quality I recommend you don't waste your money on this product. Just sorry I didn't check it out when I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Judyb

customer_reviews.title: Handy for shoppers, price is hefty
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my mom who's a shop-a-holic. It's better than hauling a metal basket around town. It is especially handy for seniors that like to shop and be independent. The handle is soft but firm enough for gentle hands to grip, pocket spaces for carrying an umbrella or smaller items, the instructions are easy to understand so assembly is quick and easy, and the wheels are quiet and smooth, especially going up stairs, getting on the bus, or up a short lifted sidewalk. Only the price is a bit hefty here than QVC.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Francis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! It works great on stairs! Would highly recommend. It could use a longer handle but I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeepgeek

customer_reviews.title: Not as amazing as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a dolly that could easily go up stairs. It's just as hard to pull this up stairs as a regular dolly. They make it look so magical on tv.
customer_reviews.author: D-cat

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY CART.
customer_reviews.text: HAVE ANOTHER CART OF LESSER QUALITY. TROLLEY DOLLY STANDS OUT. ONE DOWN SIDE. STAIR CLIMBER WHEELS HIT ON WIDE LOADS. TWENTY FOUR CASE OF CANS CAN NOT WALK UP STAIRS.
customer_reviews.author: P. E.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend brought one on our trip to help unload luggage and bags from the car. It was so helpful I went home and ordered one for myself. It folds down easily and I keep it in my trunk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is in college and lives on the fourth floor of her apartment building. She put this together herself. She walks and takes it to the grocery store, loads it up, and is able to get her groceries up to her apartment with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Momofmany2019

customer_reviews.title: Great for shopping by bus
customer_reviews.text: Use this trolley weekly to grocery shop; EXACTLY what I need. I added bungie cords for load stability. Holds groceries for 1; larger households would need more trips.
customer_reviews.author: Msmoskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Bag fell apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: The frame is satisfactory. The bag suffers from inferior workmanship, materials, and design. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: 56phl

customer_reviews.title: Needs some sort of brake
customer_reviews.text: It climbed the stairs well, but you have to hold the weight the entire time as it rolls back. I wish there was a way to squeeze a brake that would lock the wheels so it couldn't roll back. At least it could rest a minute on the steps.
customer_reviews.author: PollyPurchaser

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for several bags of groceries up my 3 flights of stairs. My trips have been cut in half with no sore elbows and wrists from carrying numerous bags. I was also able to use it for my carry on suitcase. I only wish the platform was placed a little higher above the wheels though so I could use it for wider boxes and small furniture. Family and neighbors are curious about it and like the color and pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy duty use.
customer_reviews.text: Returned it after the wheel fell off! Might be OJ on flat ground with no stairs, but then you wouldn't need it!
customer_reviews.author: Dapusher

customer_reviews.title: Handel  needs work
customer_reviews.text: This is great thinking about a second one. Good for wife she is 5"1 I am 6"1 hight good for her not me. A Handel that adjusts would be better .
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Second time the charm.
customer_reviews.text: First order, wheels kept falling off. There are instruction for attaching the locking wheels, and since this is my 3rd product from the manufacturer (different styles and colors), I am familiar with how to do it, and have a second person tug on wheels to be sure assembled. Third time using, wheels fell off and the over-the dolly arm strap at upper back ripped from seam. I decided to see if I could exchange, and new one arrived today. Wheels definitely on for the long term, and this bag came with nice padded carry shoulder strap, in addition to the secure to dolly strap, which was double stitched on both sides an inch from seam!
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Austin

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day and is the best, don't have to use the carts at the stores or take a lot of bags. Has plenty of space and works great.
customer_reviews.author: DaniDan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my mobility lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: I have used it a lot so far, walking on through the snow, bringing my groceries from Walmart to home, or loading the water bottle refill. It has made my life easier. So far I've been using it almost for a year and still looks in a very good shape, looks durable. Definitely it's a "must have" utility at home. Everybody envy my trolley dolley. One thing to improve are the designs, you could do a variety of designs on colors and forms.
customer_reviews.author: iPadUser

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Out of box - piece of plastic was broken off from the frame? Difficult to turn with, very small - you are lucky if you can get a few bags in this - 1 case of water takes up the entire thing. Would not suggest this to anyone....too small
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Made it into a mini bicycle trailer with a couple bungee cords
customer_reviews.text: Still working well 3 years later, mostly used for groceries and a guitar amp. The base is kind of small. I'd get some lashing straps or bungee cords if you plan on using anything besides the bag. The handle height is slightly low for me, but not that bad. It's actually perfect for me to strap to the back of my bike's cargo rack, which is very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Greenblot

customer_reviews.title: What a great find
customer_reviews.text: Love this helper. We use it for bringing water for our water cooler. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Library lady

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I was a little concerned that this item would not be very solidly constructed but I was pleasantly surprised. I have not used it for heavy loads yet but I did roll it up and down my stairs and it worked perfectly. I would say I am more than satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Holland

customer_reviews.title: Harriet
customer_reviews.text: The person I bought this for loves it! She has to go up and down three flights of stairs to do her laundry. This has come in very handy for laundry and grocery shopping. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Harriet A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried to put it together and one of the wheel locks instantly broke
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Welch

customer_reviews.title: light use, works easily on steps, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My brother got it assembled in one try. It came with extra pieces. I have only used it once for laundry and it works effortlessly consideringI am 70, the laundry is heavy & the steps are steep.
customer_reviews.author: golitely

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice but does not hold a lot if you do a big grocery shopping day. Wheels are good, quality is as expected and you will get your money's worth. I should have bought one with more size capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: This really works good even going up my 3 stairs on my porch ...
customer_reviews.text: This really works good even going up my 3 stairs on my porch at my trailer. It holds a lot of bags and most of all my back and time when I have a bunch of bags and heavy things So I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: peewee

customer_reviews.title: Love This Cart!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart! So do my kids! Even when it’s heavy, we have no problem getting it up and down stairs. We love it!! Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Olds

product_meta.title: dbest products Stair Climber Trolley Dolly, Morrocan Tile Shopping Grocery Foldable Cart Condo Apartment
product_meta.description: Stair Climber Trolley Dolly is the ideal Multi-Purpose hand truck to help you carry your groceries and other items up a flight of stair, curbs, sidewalks and other terrains. The Stair climber cart is collapsible for compact storage or it can become your easy to use portable Dolly while on the go. Whether you are running errands, shopping, moving boxes of supplies this dolly can help you carry it all! Stress-free without worrying how you will transport all your belongings or other goods. Our Trolley Dolly bag is able to carry all your items in ONE LARGE BAG IN ONE TRIP!! Let our new fully functional 6-wheel design do all the heavy lifting for you. It can lift all your belongings upstairs, downstairs, curbs or uneven paths. Take it to the supermarket, flea market or the beach; Capable of climbing high curbs and sidewalks with ease. The weatherproof material of the trolley bags keep contents dry from the rain, snow and the other forces of nature; Also includes soft ergonomic cushion handle which reduces the stress on the hands; Ideal for mobile seniors or shoppers without vehicles.
feature_bullets: Our folding Stair Climber Trolley Dolly cart perfectly balances lightweight capability with durability and features 6-wheel design that glides up and down stairs with ease. Take it to the supermarket, flea market or the beach.
Collapsible and Portable; Easily folds down in half for compact storage when not in use; Store in the trunk of your car, under the bed, in the closet or garage.

Multi-functional Uses; Use it as a shopping cart, grocery cart, utility cart, foldable cart, and overall exceptional cart on wheels with little to no assembly required; Remove the bag and it becomes a lightweight dolly capable of carrying up to 110 lbs.
Live in a Apartment or Condo,no problem The Stair Climber Trolley Dolly climbs stairs more smoothly than any other stair climber cart or trolley on the market.
Contains 7 compartments for storage, which include a beverage holder, front flap pocket, inner pouch, rear pocket and more; Your stuff goes where you go.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars88 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
